details.title: Commentary - two reliability war stories

p: Ted W. Yellman has 42 years experience in aerospace and electronics design, reliability and safety engineering—including 7 years as an Engineering Assurance Manager. He is the “inventor” of Event-Sequence Analysis, which is an alternative to fault-tree analysis.

details.abstract: The author describes his experiences with failure of tone-pulse converter boards used in telephony, and audio-accessory units used in aircraft, and how the problems were overcome. His experience with the failure analysis of CMOS PROM devices is also described.
